column2: Product Owner facilitates user story development, prioritization and negotiation
column3: Product Owner collaborates proactively with Product Management and other stakeholders
column4: User Stories are small, estimated, functional and vertical
column5: Product owner facilitates development of acceptance criteria which are used in planning, review and story acceptance
column6: Teams refine the backlog every sprint
column7: Team participates fully in Release Planning and Inspect and Adapt
column8: Product backlog for the PSI is itemized and prioritized
column9: Teams proactively interact with other teams on the train as necessary to resolve impediments
column10: Team participates in System Demo every two weeks, illustrating real progress towards objectives
column11: Team reliably meet 80-100% of non-stretch PSI Objecives
column12: Team plans the sprint collaboratively, effectively and efficiently
column13: Team always has clear sprint goals, in support of PSI objectives, and commits to meeting them
column14: Teams apply acceptance criteria and Definition of Done to story acceptance
column15: Team has a predictable, normalized velocity which is used for estimating and planning
column16: Team regularly delivers on their sprint goals
column17: Team members are self-organized, respect each other, help each other complete sprint goals, manage interdependencies and stay in-sync with each other
column18: Scrum Master attends Scrum of Scrums and interacts with RTE as appropriate
column19: Stories are iterated through the sprint with multiple define-build-test cycles (e.g. the sprint is not a waterfalled)
column20: Team holds collaborative, effective and efficient planning and daily meetings where all members participate, status is given clearly, issues are raised, obstacles are removed and information exchanged
column21: Team holds a retrospective after each sprint and makes incremental changes to continually improve its performance
column22: Teams actively reduce technical debt in each sprint
column23: Team has clear guidance and understanding of intentional architecture guidance, but is free and flexible enough to allow emergent design to support optimal implementation
column24: Automated acceptance tests and unit tests are part of story DoD
column26: CI, build and test automation infrastructure is improving
column27: What team are you reporting for?
column28: What month are you reporting for?
column29: # of active, separate, parallel work threads
column34: How many new production defects were created this month?
column44: What was your team's average committed velocity for the month, for all completed sprints?
column45: What was your team's average delivered velocity for the month, for all completed sprints?
column46: In hours, what was the average cycle time for a story, from development start to done, for the month?
column47: How many stories were done this month?

column39: No proper analysis phase for release level plan

column41: Team trained & coached in story writing

column40: Lack of business SMEs that articulate the business domain, and requirements
column43: Rotating assignment to dedicated operations & support role
